Row.Text: The Landwehr is one of two unique units for Prussia. Unlike the Line Infantry that it replaces, the Landwehr gains a [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Bonus when adjacent to another Military Unit. This bonus is doubled should this Military Unit also be a Landwehr.

The Death's Head Hussar is Prussia's second unique unit. It is a replacement for the Cuirassier, however, unlike the Cuirassier, the Death's Head Hussar ignores enemy Zone of Control and may cause enemy units to take damage by simply entering into an adjacent tile. It also reduces the [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength of any enemy unit within two tiles. These abilities are lost on upgrade, however.

Our nobility have tended to this land for generations, and the Junkers, the young Lords of Prussia, have served our military well. In honour of their service, let us grant them greater privileges. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Requirements:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Prussia. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have researched {1_TechDesc}. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Costs:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{2_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]4 Units become maintenance free. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Receive a small boost in [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production toward Landwehrs whenever a new [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen is born (even when a Landwehr isn't in the production queue).

Our nobility have tended to this land for generations, and the Junkers, the young Lords of Prussia, have served our military well. In honour of their service, let us grant them greater privileges. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Requirements:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Prussia. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have researched {1_TechDesc}. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must not have passed the 'Privilaged Peerage' [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Reform. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Costs:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{2_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]2 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Passes the 'Privileged Peerage' [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Reform for free. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]4 Units become maintenance free. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Receive a small boost in [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production toward Landwehrs whenever a new [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen is born (even when a Landwehr isn't in the production queue).

Our nobility have tended to this land for generations, and the Junkers, the young Lords of Prussia, have served our military well. In honour of their service, let us grant them greater privileges. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]4 Units become maintenance free [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Receive a small boost in [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production toward Landwehrs whenever a new [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen is born (even when a Landwehr isn't in the production queue).

Our nobility have tended to this land for generations, and the Junkers, the young Lords of Prussia, have served our military well. In honour of their service, let us grant them greater privileges. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Passes the 'Privileged Peerage' [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Reform for free. It is upon the most distinguished soldiers and generals of our military that Prussia's security depends. To see that they are recognised for this service, let us award them the highest possible honour: the Pour le Mérite. ------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Requirements:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Prussia. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted from the beginning of the Renaissance Era. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May not be enacted from the beginning of the Modern Era. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per era. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Costs:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 {2_ResourceDesc}. [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Upgrades all current Great Generals into either a Mounted or a Gun Unit, each beginning with +30XP. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Note: A Great General will only be upgraded into a Mounted Unit if you have an available [ICON_RES_HORSE] Horse resource[ENDCOLOR]

It is upon the most distinguished soldiers and generals of our military that Prussia's security depends. To see that they are recognised for this service, let us award them the highest possible honour: the Pour le Mérite.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rewards:[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE]------------------------- [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Upgrades all current Great Generals into either a Mounted or a Gun Unit, each beginning with +30XP.
The people of {1_CityName} have invented Bratwurst - a type of sausage made of veal, pork, or beef!

In our present war with {1_CivDesc}, many soldiers have died to starvation, not battle. They have begun calling this the 'potato war.' Before long, we may sustain too many casaulties to sustain this war![NEWLINE]
Disaster! But we must push on.
Perhaps it is time to broker a peace.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]60% chance that peace is brokered with {1_CivDesc}[ENDCOLOR]
We have determined to continue in our war against {1_CivDesc}, despite the starvation of our troops.
We have petitioned {1_CivDesc} for peace, and we have been successful.
We have petitioned {1_CivDesc} for peace, but alas, this has been to no avail.

The great works of General Carl von Clausewitz has finally been compiled into one. Clausewitz's essays and treatises on the art of war are an indispensable and praiseworthy ally to our military career.[NEWLINE]
We must re-read it at once!
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]All current Military Land Units gain 10 XP[ENDCOLOR]
Carl von Clausewitz' 'On War' has been compiled and we have spent many nights pouring over its contents. It shall make a fine accompanyment to our future military glory.
Carl von Clausewitz' 'On War' has been published in the {1_CivName}.
